intro: Weberbauera bracteata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or bracteate weberbauer, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
